intro: Lychnis coronata var. verticillata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are arranged in whorls around the stem, giving it a distinctive, compact appearance. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, moist soil.
